benefits.title: Effects of whey protein isolate on body composition, lipids, insulin and glucose in overweight and obese individuals
benefits.summary: Whey protein supplementation improves fasting lipids and insulin levels in overweight and obese individuals.

benefits.title: Whey Protein Improves Marathon-Induced Injury and Exercise Performance in Elite Track Runners
benefits.summary: Whey protein supplementation improves exercise performance in elite track runners and ameliorates exercise injuries.

benefits.title: Efficacy of oral supplementation of whey protein in patients with contact dermatitis: A pilot randomized double‐blind placebo‐controlled clinical trial
benefits.summary: Oral supplementation of whey protein could improve the symptoms of contact dermatitis compared to placebo.

benefits.title: The Chronic Effects of Whey Proteins on Blood Pressure, Vascular Function, and Inflammatory Markers in Overweight Individuals
benefits.summary: Whey protein supplementation improves blood pressure and vascular function in overweight and obese individuals.

benefits.title: Stability of Whey Proteins during Thermal Processing: A Review
benefits.summary: Whey proteins have high nutritional value and various applications in food products, but their instability to thermal processing can lead to denaturation, aggregation, and gelation.
benefits.journal: Comprehensive Reviews in Food Science and Food Safety

benefits.title: Functional food relevance of whey protein: A review of recent findings and scopes ahead
benefits.summary: Whey protein has been validated to confer radical scavenging, anti-inflammatory, antitumor, immunostimulatory, hypotensive, gut homeostasis, antiobesity, antidiabetic, muscle biosynthesis, osteoprotective, and radioprotective roles.

benefits.title: The effects of whey protein on cardiometabolic risk factors
benefits.summary: Whey protein consumption may have beneficial effects on some symptoms of the metabolic syndrome and a reduction in cardiovascular risk factors, such as obesity and muscle-protective roles.

benefits.title: Bovine whey peptides transit the intestinal barrier to reduce oxidative stress in muscle cells.
benefits.summary: Whey protein consumption delivers bioactive peptides to target cells, reducing oxidative stress in muscle and liver cells.

benefits.title: Whey for Sarcopenia; Can Whey Peptides, Hydrolysates or Proteins Play a Beneficial Role?
benefits.summary: Whey protein supplementation of 35g daily is likely to improve sarcopenic biomarkers in frail or sarcopenia individuals, and may also improve muscle mTOR signaling in older adults.

benefits.title: Emerging trends in nutraceutical applications of whey protein and its derivatives
benefits.summary: Whey protein confers benefits against metabolic diseases, boosts recovery from exercise injuries, stimulates gut physiology, and protects skin against detrimental radiations.
benefits.journal: Journal of Food Science and Technology

side effects.title: Influence of pH, Casein, and Whey Protein Denaturation on the Composition, Crystal Size, and Yield of Lactose from Condensed Whey
side effects.summary: Excessive whey protein denaturation increases viscosity, decreases lactose crystal size, and makes washing of the crude lactose more difficult.

side effects.title: Effects of combination of whey protein intake and rehabilitation on muscle strength and daily movements in patients with hip fracture in the early postoperative period.
side effects.summary: Whey protein intake combined with rehabilitation for two weeks in the early postoperative period improves knee extension strength and transfer, walking, and toilet use scores in patients with hip fracture.

side effects.title: Effects of whey peptides on cardiovascular disease risk factors.
side effects.summary: Whey-derived peptides can lower blood pressure and improve lipid profiles, making them a viable treatment option for prehypertensive and/or stage 1 hypertensive populations.

side effects.title: Model studies on reactions of plant phenols with whey proteins.
side effects.summary: Whey proteins treated with plant phenols can negatively affect digestion and alter their physicochemical properties.

side effects.title: Whey proteins as a food supplement in HIV-seropositive individuals.
side effects.summary: Whey protein supplementation increased body weight and elevated glutathione levels in HIV-seropositive individuals without adverse side effects.
side effects.journal: Clinical and investigative medicine. Medecine clinique et experimentale

side effects.title: Effect of high-pressure treatment on the electrospray ionization mass spectrometry (ESI-MS) profiles of whey proteins
side effects.summary: High-pressure treatment of whey proteins can result in substantial changes in the charge-state distribution of pure Î± -lactoglobulin, affecting rheological and nutraceutical properties.

side effects.title: Are oral protein supplements helpful in the management of malnutrition in dialysis patients?
side effects.summary: Oral protein supplements in dialysis patients were not tolerated, with side effects such as bloating, nausea with vomiting, and anorexia.

side effects.title: Anti-inflammatory potential of a malleable matrix composed of fermented whey proteins and lactic acid bacteria in an atopic dermatitis model
side effects.summary: The fermented whey protein-based product, Malleable Protein Matrix (MPM), showed strong reduction of ear inflammation without side effects in an atopic dermatitis model.

side effects.title: Whey Protein Supplementation Improves Nutritional Status, Glutathione Levels, and Immune Function in Cancer Patients: A Randomized, Double-Blind Controlled Trial.
side effects.summary: Whey protein supplementation can increase GSH levels and improve nutritional status and immunity in cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy.

side effects.title: Whey protein edible films modified with almond and walnut oils
side effects.summary: Almond and walnut oils at low concentrations enhance the hydrophobic character of whey protein films, making them suitable for edible films or coatings in food applications.

dosage.title: Effect of Whey Supplementation on Circulating C-Reactive Protein: A Meta-Analysis of Randomized Controlled Trials
dosage.summary: Whey protein supplementation may significantly reduce CRP levels with doses 20g/day or with increased baseline CRP levels.

dosage.title: An open-label dose–response study of lymphocyte glutathione levels in healthy men and women receiving pressurized whey protein isolate supplements
dosage.summary: Pressurized whey protein supplementation of 45 g/day for 2 weeks can increase lymphocyte GSH by 24%.
dosage.journal: International Journal of Food Sciences and Nutrition

dosage.title: Influence of whey protein and its hydrolysate on prehypertension and postprandial hyperglycaemia in adult men
dosage.summary: Whey protein hydrolysate (WPH) dosages of 0.2g kg 1 and 0.4g kg 1 significantly reduced postprandial glucose levels in type 2 diabetic subjects.

dosage.title: Evaluation of whey protein as a natural hydrate kinetic inhibitor
dosage.summary: Whey protein dosage increases linearly with hydrate inhibition performance until it reaches approximately 2.5 wt% in pure water systems.

dosage.title: Anti-ulcerogenic effect of a whey protein isolate and collagen hydrolysates against ethanol ulcerative lesions on oral administration to rats.
dosage.summary: Whey protein isolate and collagen hydrolysates reduced the ulcerative lesion index (ULI) in a range of 40-77%, depending on the dosage.

dosage.title: Study on Whey Protein-pullulan-ferulic Acid Complex of Edible Film
dosage.summary: Whey protein concentrate and pullulan with ferulic acid dosages of 200 mg/100 mL and 150 mg/100 mL improve membrane performance in edible films.

dosage.title: Розробка комплексного хлібопекарського поліпшувача «свіжість КСБ +» для подовження свіжості булочних виробів
dosage.summary: The optimal dosage of whey protein in the "KSB Freshness +" complex bakery improver is 1.5% to the weight of flour, extending the freshness of unpackaged bakery products to 72 hours.

dosage.title: Protective Effect of Whey Protein and Polypeptide from Small Black Soybean on Acute Liver Injury in Mice
dosage.summary: Whey protein and polypeptide from small black soybean were fed to mice at doses of 6 g/(kg?d) and 2 g/(kg?d) for 30 days.

dosage.title: Modification of soy whey protein by trypsinase
dosage.summary: The optimal conditions for modifying soy whey protein are 2% substrate concentration, 3 500 U/100 g protein, 3 hours hydrolyzation time, and 60°C temperature.

dosage.title: Flux Enhancement in Hollow Fiber Ultrafiltration for the Recovery of Acid Cheese Whey Precipitates
dosage.summary: Polyelectrolyte precipitation with CMC dosages ranging from 0.25 to 3.5 kg/m3 doubles permeate flux in ultrafiltration of acid cheese whey.
